[CALCITE-912] Add Avatica OpenConnectionRequest (Bruno Dumon)

Goal: passing of connection properties (the 'info') from the remote
avatica driver to the corresponding server-side connection.

Changes include:
 * in Meta: explicit opening of connections: there is a new
   openConnection() call. Client decides on the connection id.
   Implicit creation of unknown connections is gone.
 * JdbcMeta: default connection is gone, all methods have been
   extended with a connection id.
 * correspondingly, the various Service.Request's now carry a
   connection id (will make fixing CALCITE-871 easy)
 * (unrelated, but was useful for testing) more meaningful error
   messages in remote driver

[CALCITE-785] Add "Piglet", a subset of Pig Latin on top of Calcite algebra

Includes a parser, DISTINCT, ORDER, LIMIT and GROUP commands, and an
incomplete nested FOREACH command.

Add tests based on examples in PigLatin reference.

Description:

Simplify how synthetics are used in preparation for implementing
Ihab's custom node idea for pluggable code generators.


Goal
====
Ihab pointed out that the current synthetic mechanism combined with
pipelining makes it impossible to make the TCB smaller than all
possible code that a pipeline author could write.

There are a couple existing pipeline stages that generate synthetic
content -- GXP templates for HTML, CSS templates, the HtmlCompiler
code that extracts HTML event handlers.

The goal of this CL is to lay the groundwork for a narrow definition
of synthetic, so that we can have both an extensible pipeline and a
small TCB.


Design
======
Create a few custom nodes with rigorous consistency checks that are
passed through by the DefaultCajaRewriter.

The custom nodes will be part of the TCB, and any user code they
contain must be exposed as children.  At render time, the custom nodes
construct a parse tree of regular node, and delegate rendering to
that.


Material Changes in this CL
===========================
Previously, any node could be marked synthetic.  Now only
FunctionConstructors and Identifiers can.  Since SyntheticNodes.java
now knows about JS node types, I moved it into ...parser.js from
...parser.

Previously there was one rewriter rule that did an expandAll on any
synthetic node.  Now there is one per specific construct that we want
to pass through.

Changed QuasiBuilder so that when it parses a quasiliteral,
identifiers that end in __ are marked synthetic since they are clearly
intentional rules violations.

Added /*@synthetic*/ syntax to specify that the next synthesizable node
in a quasiliteral should be synthetic when produced in subst.


Other Changes in this CL
========================
Got rid of all the semicolon insertion warnings from
DefaultCajaRewriterTest's logs.

Fixed bug:  parser was expecting a semicolon after with-statements.


Open Questions
==============
Why do we need to ignore synthetic functions in determining in which
scope temporaries are declared?


Still TODO
==========
Define custom nodes for html event handlers and other code generators,
and get rid of the rules for Identifier and FunctionConstructor.




git-svn-id: https://google-caja.googlecode.com/svn/trunk@2085 360991c0-9f3b-0410-ba87-8b362a00edf4

faster ParseTreeNode visitor
http://codereview.appspot.com/6305076

ParseTreeNode has tree-walk methods called acceptPreOrder and
acceptPostOrder that are worst-case O(n) space and O(n**2) time.

The O(n) space is because ParseTreeNode does not have a link
to the node's parent, but some visitors want to know a node's
parent, so the tree-walker constructs a new AncestorChain object
to hold a node and its parent, then gives that AncestorChain to
the visitor.  This is wasted effort when a visitor doesn't care
about a node's parent.

The O(n**2) time is because the tree-walker tries to be robust
against mutations to the tree that affect the current node's
place in the tree, so before (or after) visiting each node,
it checks whether the node is still a child of the parent,
which requires a linear search of the parent's children list.

So, previously I had replaced one instance of acceptPreOrder
with a faster visitPreOrder method.

This patch expands on that, makes visitPreOrder faster and
simpler, and also uses it in more places.

To conform to the Set equality contract TransitionTarget must implement the equals and hashcode methods.
But in the context of SCXML and the purpose of the algorithm, really only identity based equality should be considered.
The TransitionTarget#id property also could be used, but that would make the API much more awkward to ensure only unique IDs are used, that is: within the context of a single SCXML instance.
Much easier therefore is to just enforce and only support identity based equality.

with '-' because of the Html 5 and XML 1 specs.

can be seen in the following discussions:

http://marcorogers.com/blog/08-02-2009/strange-firefox-rendering-bug

consecutive hyphens, to make them spec-compliant.
